game.gamegui

Class Camera

  • java.lang.Object
    • game.gamegui.Camera

  • public class Camera
extends java.lang.Object
    Responsible for moving around in the game. Moves the position of the image on which the game is drawn around. Only works while the window is smaller than the game itself (width and height separately) Created by flavia on 17.03.17.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Camera(Window window) 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      float getXPosition() 
      float getYPosition() 
      void moveDown()
      Moves the whole map by scrollSpeed pixels down, if the window's height is smaller than the map height.
      void moveLeft()
      Moves the whole map by scrollSpeed pixels to the left, if the window's width is smaller than the map width.
      void moveRight()
      Moves the whole map by scrollSpeed pixels to the right, if the window's width is smaller than the map width.
      void moveUp()
      Moves the whole map by scrollSpeed pixels up, if the window's height is smaller than the map height.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Camera

        public Camera(Window window)

    • Method Detail

      • getXPosition

        public float getXPosition()
        Returns:
        x

      • getYPosition

        public float getYPosition()
        Returns:
        y

      • moveRight

        public void moveRight()
        Moves the whole map by scrollSpeed pixels to the right, if the window's width is smaller than the map width. If the map would move too far (the window background would be shown) it is set exactly to the end of the window.

      • moveDown

        public void moveDown()
        Moves the whole map by scrollSpeed pixels down, if the window's height is smaller than the map height. If the map would move too far (the window background would be shown) it is set exactly to the end of the window.

      • moveLeft

        public void moveLeft()
        Moves the whole map by scrollSpeed pixels to the left, if the window's width is smaller than the map width. If the map would move too far (the window background would be shown) it is set exactly to the end of the window.

      • moveUp

        public void moveUp()
        Moves the whole map by scrollSpeed pixels up, if the window's height is smaller than the map height. If the map would move too far (the window background would be shown) it is set exactly to the end of the window.
